sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An excellent sonnet of the unfortunate loves, of Hero and Leander Tune of, Gerards mistris. Crouch, Humphrey, fl. 1635-1671.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright, [London] : [ca. 1674]
Verse - "How fares my fair Leander, I vouchsafe to speak,". Singed at end: H. Crouch. Place of publication from Wing, which estimates 1663-1674 as publication date. Reproduction of the originals in: British Library (reel 2123.2:150-151); University of Glasgow Library (reel 2685:10).
=======

Verse - "How fares my fair Leander, I vouchsafe to speak,". Singed at end: H. Crouch. Place of publication from Wing, which estimates 1663-1674 as publication date. Reproduction of the originals in: British Library (reel 2123.2:150-151); University of Glasgow Library (reel 2685:10).

J. Wright
T. Vere
